1.descricao:
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
1.texto: Ixidor had only to imagine their ruin and Akroma made it so.

regras.texto: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

2.descricao: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.
2.texto:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—Song of All, canto 642

regras.texto: Creatures are counted during resolution.

3.descricao:
Kicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} as you cast this spell.)

When Kor Sanctifiers enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target artifact or enchantment.
3.texto: "Why keep such trinkets? They only add weight to your travels."

4.descricao:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.

When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

regras.texto: If Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted nonland permanent forever.

If there are no nonland permanents on the battlefield other than an Oblivion Ring, and the card it exiled was another Oblivion Ring, casting a third Oblivion Ring will result in an involuntary infinite loop that will end the game in a draw (unless someone chooses to break it by putting another nonland permanent onto the battlefield or destroying one of the Oblivion Rings, for example).

If the exiled card is an Aura, that card's owner chooses what it will enchant as it comes back onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way doesn't target anything, but the Aura's enchant ability restricts what it can be attached to. If the Aura can't legally be attached to anything, it remains exiled forever.

Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.

5.descricao:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)

Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If Orim's Thunder was kicked, it deals damage equal to that permanent's converted mana cost to target creature.

6.descricao:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.

Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may attach Prison Term to that creature.

regras.texto: The last ability works only if Prison Term is already on the battlefield. You may move it from the creature it's currently enchanting onto the new creature.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]

7.descricao: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
7.texto: "One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance."

regras.texto: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other's ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

8.descricao:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)

Flying

Broodstar's power and toughness are each equal to the number of artifacts you control.

9.descricao: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
9.texto: "The secret to invention is to see something in your mind, then find where it hides in the world."

10.descricao: Draw a card for each attacking creature.
10.texto: "I see their moral dilemmas. I see their raw courage. I see their self-sacrifice. I see our victory."

11.descricao:
Master of Etherium's power and toughness are each equal to the number of artifacts you control.

Other artifact creatures you control get +1/+1.
11.texto: "Only a mind unfettered with the concerns of the flesh can see the world as it truly is."

regras.texto: The only difference between a colored artifact and a colorless artifact is, obviously, its color. Unlike most artifacts, a colored artifact requires colored mana to cast. Also unlike most artifacts, a colored artifact has a color in all zones. It will interact with cards that care about color. Other than that, a colored artifact behaves just like any other artifact. It will interact as normal with any card that cares about artifacts, such as Shatter or Arcbound Ravager.
The first ability works in all zones.
Since Master of Etherium is an artifact itself, while it's on the battlefield you will usually control at least one artifact.

12.descricao:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)

Flying
12.texto: Even the clouds bend themselves to Memnarch's will, eager to swallow those who oppose him.

13.descricao:
{2}: Sarcomite Myr gains flying until end of turn.

{2}, Sacrifice Sarcomite Myr: Draw a card.
13.texto:
"A horrible sight, yes, but the sounds . . . Its twanging tendons and grinding gears are almost musical."
—Brudiclad, Telchor engineer

regras.texto: Sarcomite Myr is an artifact creature, just like Ornithopter. The only difference between this and any other artifact creature is that Sarcomite Myr is blue since it has blue mana in its mana cost.

14.descricao: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards unless you discard an artifact card.
14.texto: Lymph, the fluid essence of blinkmoths, is prized by wizards for the rush of intellect it provides.

regras.texto: You can discard either one artifact card or two cards which may or may not be artifacts. If you really want to, you can discard two artifact cards.

15.descricao: {T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.
15.texto: Art is unknown to the vedalken—for them, all creations must serve a purpose.

16.descricao:
If an opponent had two or more creatures enter the battlefield under his or her control this turn, you may pay {U} rather than pay Whiplash Trap's mana cost.

Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.

regras.texto: You may ignore a Trap's alternative cost condition and simply cast it for its normal mana cost. This is true even if its alternative cost condition has been met.
Casting a Trap by paying its alternative cost doesn't change its mana cost or converted mana cost. The only difference is the cost you actually pay.
Effects that increase or reduce the cost to cast a Trap will apply to whichever cost you chose to pay.
You must target two creatures as you cast Whiplash Trap. If you can't (because just one creature is on the battlefield, perhaps), you can't cast the spell.
You can target any two creatures, not just ones that entered the battlefield this turn.

17.descricao:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

Other black creatures get +1/+1.

Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.
17.texto: His soul snared by an angel's curse, Crovax twisted heroism into its purest shadow.

regras.texto: If Ascendant Evincar stops being black, it gives itself -1/-1.

18.descricao: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.
18.texto: A vertical scream pierces the night air and echoes doom through the clouds.

regras.texto: If a Beacon is countered, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

19.descricao:
({2/B} can be paid with any two mana or with {B}. This card's converted mana cost is 6.)

Search your library for a card with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of lands you control, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
19.texto: Those who hear her go mad with inspiration.

regras.texto: If an effect reduces the cost to cast a spell by an amount of generic mana, it applies to a monocolored hybrid spell only if you've chosen a method of paying for it that includes generic mana.

A card with a monocolored hybrid mana symbol in its mana cost is each of the colors that appears in its mana cost, regardless of what mana was spent to cast it. Thus, Beseech the Queen is black even if you spend six red mana to cast it.

A card with monocolored hybrid mana symbols in its mana cost has a converted mana cost equal to the highest possible cost it could be cast for. Its converted mana cost never changes. Thus, Beseech the Queen has a converted mana cost of 6, even if you spend {B}{B}{B} to cast it.

If a cost includes more than one monocolored hybrid mana symbol, you can choose a different way to pay for each symbol. For example, you can pay for Beseech the Queen by spending {B}{B}{B}, {2}{B}{B}, {4}{B}, or {6}.

20.descricao:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

{1}{B}{B}: Regenerate Cadaverous Knight.
20.texto:
Grieve for the soul in death dishonored.
—Shadow Guild saying

21.descricao:
Spend only black mana on X.

Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

regras.texto: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell is countered. You won't gain any life.

22.descricao: {1}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for a Zombie card and a Swamp card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: You do not have to find a Zombie card or swamp card if you do not want to, even if you have them in your library.

23.descricao: Destroy target non-Zombie creature. It can't be regenerated. Return up to one target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
23.texto: Few Cabal fighters fear death. They fear what follows it.

24.texto:
"If there is such a thing as too much power, I have not discovered it."
—Volrath

25.descricao: Skeleton creatures you control and other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1 and have deathtouch.
25.texto: For the necromancer barons, killing and recruitment are one and the same.

regras.texto: A creature that's both a Skeleton and a Zombie will get the bonus only once.
Death Baron doesn't normally affect itself. If you manage to turn it into a Skeleton, however, then it will give itself +1/+1 and deathtouch.

26.descricao: Unearth {B} ({B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)
26.texto: The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.

regras.texto: If you activate a card's unearth ability but that card is removed from your graveyard before the ability resolves, that unearth ability will resolve and do nothing.

Activating a creature card's unearth ability isn't the same as casting the creature card. The unearth ability is put on the stack, but the creature card is not. Spells and abilities that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle) will interact with unearth, but spells and abilities that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul) will not.

At the beginning of the end step, a creature returned to the battlefield with unearth is exiled. This is a delayed triggered ability, and it can be countered by effects such as Stifle or Voidslime that counter triggered abilities. If the ability is countered, the creature will stay on the battlefield and the delayed trigger won't trigger again. However, the replacement effect will still exile the creature when it eventually leaves the battlefield.

Unearth grants haste to the creature that's returned to the battlefield. However, neither of the "exile" abilities is granted to that creature. If that creature loses all its abilities, it will still be exiled at the beginning of the end step, and if it would leave the battlefield, it is still exiled instead.

If a creature returned to the battlefield with unearth would leave the battlefield for any reason, it's exiled instead -- unless the spell or ability that's causing the creature to leave the battlefield is actually trying to exile it! In that case, it succeeds at exiling it. If it later returns the creature card to the battlefield (as Oblivion Ring or Flickerwisp might, for example), the creature card will return to the battlefield as a new object with no relation to its previous existence. The unearth effect will no longer apply to it.

27.descricao: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
27.texto: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.

28.descricao: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.
28.texto:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

regras.texto: Each other player sacrifices a creature for each creature you control that goes to a graveyard.

29.descricao: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
29.texto: Oddly, no one questioned the Cabal's wisdom in hiring a zombie to work at the cemetery.

regras.texto: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

30.descricao: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target land. If that land was nonbasic, untap Helldozer.
30.texto: Sometimes you go to hell, and sometimes hell comes to you.

31.descricao: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.
31.texto:
"A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize."
—Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words

regras.texto: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Hideous End resolves, the entire spell is countered. No one loses life.

32.descricao: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature, two -1/-1 counters on another target creature, and three -1/-1 counters on a third target creature.
32.texto: Shadowmoor's main crops are rot, slime, and despair.

regras.texto: You must target three different creatures. If you can't, you can't cast Incremental Blight.

33.texto: Zombies mourn for the living and celebrate those who will soon be given the gift of death.

34.descricao: Whenever Nefashu attacks, up to five target creatures each get -1/-1 until end of turn.
34.texto: Where the nefashu pass, blood rolls like a silk carpet.

35.descricao: Whenever Noxious Ghoul or another Zombie enters the battlefield, all non-Zombie creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
35.texto: Plague and death wrapped in one convenient package.

36.descricao: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
36.texto: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.

37.descricao: Sacrifice a creature: Phyrexian Ghoul gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
37.texto: Phyrexia wastes nothing. Its food chain is a spiraling cycle.

38.descricao: Choose two — Target player loses X life; or return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield; or target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn; or up to X target creatures gain fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

regras.texto: The value chosen for X applies to each X in the spell's effect. You pay {X} only once.

39.descricao:
When Rotting Rats enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.

Unearth {1}{B} ({1}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

regras.texto: When Rotting Rats's enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, first the player whose turn it is chooses a card to discard, then each other player in turn order does the same, then all cards are discarded at the same time. No one sees what the other players are discarding before deciding which card to discard.

40.descricao: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each Zombie on the battlefield.
40.texto:
"My priests swore loyalty to the Cabal not until death, but beyond it."
—Cabal Patriarch

41.descricao: Soulless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Zombies on the battlefield plus the number of Zombie cards in all graveyards.

42.descricao: Each other player discards a card. You draw a card for each card discarded this way.
42.texto: When tempers run high, it's easy to lose your head.

43.descricao: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
43.texto: As Phage drank their energy, a vague memory of Jeska stirred. Then she lost herself again in the joy of her victims' suffering.

44.descricao:
Zombie spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

Zombie creatures you control get +2/+1.
44.texto: It has the strength of seven men. In fact, it used to be seven men.

45.descricao: {1}: Exile target card from a graveyard.
45.texto: Once it consecrated the dead. Now it desecrates them.

46.descricao: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.
46.texto: Rainclouds don't last long in Shiv, but that doesn't stop the lightning.

regras.texto: Each target must receive at least 1 damage. You can't choose a target to take zero damage.
You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

47.descricao: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

48.descricao: When Bogardan Firefiend dies, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
48.texto:
"The next one who tells me to relax and curl up by a fire is dead."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

regras.texto: You must pick a target creature, even if you are the only player with creatures on the battlefield.

49.descricao:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

When Bogardan Rager enters the battlefield, target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
49.texto: In the erupting heart of Bogardan, it's hard to tell hurtling volcanic rocks from pouncing volcanic beasts.

50.descricao: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to him or her. If no one does, target player draws three cards.
50.texto:
"Even the threat of power has power."
—Jeska, warrior adept

51.descricao: {X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Cinder Elemental: Cinder Elemental deals X damage to target creature or player.
51.texto: Their rage can grow to such proportions that they explode in a cloud of fire.

52.descricao: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.

regras.texto: You can't choose the same target more than once. If there aren't three different legal targets available, you can't cast the spell.

53.descricao: When Flamekin Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Elemental card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

54.descricao: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.
54.texto:
"For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim."
—Sisay, captain of the Weatherlight

regras.texto: If it enters the battlefield as the only targetable creature, it must target itself.

55.descricao: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
55.texto: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

regras.texto: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can't normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.

If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting himself or herself. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

56.descricao: Put X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

regras.texto: The tokens are named "Goblin" and are of creature type "Goblin".
X can be zero.

57.descricao: Untap all creatures and gain control of them until end of turn. They gain haste until end of turn.
57.texto:
"Maybe they wanted to be on the winning side for once."
—Matoc, lavamancer

regras.texto: You untap all creatures, control all creatures, and give all creatures Haste.

58.descricao:
Haste

Echo {2}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

When Keldon Champion enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target player.

59.descricao:
Trample, haste

When Menacing Ogre enters the battlefield, each player secretly chooses a number. Then those numbers are revealed. Each player with the highest number loses that much life. If you are one of those players, put two +1/+1 counters on Menacing Ogre.

regras.texto: You have to choose zero or a positive number. It must be an integer number.

60.descricao: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
60.texto:
"Who says lightning never strikes twice?"
—Storm shaman

regras.texto: You can assign damage to multiple targets and are not forced to assign the same amount of damage to each target.
You can't do fractional points of damage.
The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

61.descricao:
Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.

Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

62.descricao: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
62.texto: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

regras.texto: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

63.descricao:
First strike

Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rockslide Elemental.
63.texto: On Jund, even the landscape is a deadly hunter. Volcanoes, tar pits, and rock slides seem to prey upon the living.

64.descricao: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
64.texto: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."

regras.texto: X can be zero.
If X is greater than zero, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and X targets. If X is zero, you can't choose any targets.

65.texto: In the smoldering ashes of Shiv, a few dragons strive to rebuild their native land. The rest seek any opportunity to restore the broken pride of their race.

66.descricao: {T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast Elemental spells or activate abilities of Elementals.
66.texto: "Be silent and listen to your inner fire. Only then can you walk the Path of Flame."

regras.texto: The mana can be two mana of the same color, or one mana of each of two different colors. The mana can't be colorless.
You can use this mana to pay an alternative cost (such as evoke) or additional cost incurred while casting an Elemental spell. It's not limited to just that spell's mana cost.
The mana can't be spent to activate activated abilities of Elemental sources that aren't on the battlefield.

67.descricao:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)

Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Taurean Mauler.
67.texto: The power of a waterfall. The fury of an avalanche. The intellect of a gale-force wind.

68.descricao: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
68.texto:
"Surely we could tame something besides hurdas and pillarfield oxen!"
—Sheyda, Ondu gamekeeper

regras.texto: If there are three or fewer cards in your library, you'll reveal all of them.

69.descricao:
Flash

When Briarhorn enters the battlefield, target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

Evoke {1}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

regras.texto: If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters-the-battlefield trigger on the stack in either order. The one put on the stack last will resolve first.

70.descricao: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
70.texto: Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.

71.descricao:
Enchant land

Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

regras.texto: The color of mana to be generated is chosen when tapping the land for mana.

72.descricao:
Fertilid enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

{1}{G}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Fertilid: Target player searches his or her library for a basic land card and puts it onto the battlefield tapped. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

regras.texto: Although the targeted player doesn't need to find a basic land card if he or she doesn't want to, that player must shuffle his or her library.

73.descricao:
Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.
73.texto: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.

regras.texto: It does not get counters for copies of spells (as with Storm), just for spells that are actually cast.
The moving of counters is not a targeted ability.
You decide how many counters to move and where to move them when the ability resolves.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget to do so, it means you chose not to do so.

74.descricao: Ivy Elemental enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
74.texto: In the gardens of the centaurs, many travelers have mysteriously vanished while admiring the elaborate topiaries.

75.descricao:
Trample

Whenever Living Hive deals combat damage to a player, put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens onto the battlefield.
75.texto: In its center is a single red ant, a queen that regulates the hive's movements.

76.descricao: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
76.texto: Nature grows solutions to its problems.

regras.texto: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

77.descricao:
Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

Suspend 2—{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {G} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

regras.texto: You can exile a card in your hand using suspend any time you could cast that card. Consider its card type, any effect that affects when you could cast it (such as flash) and any other effects that could stop you from casting it (such as Meddling Mage's effect) to determine if and when you can do this. Whether or not you could actually complete all steps in casting the card is irrelevant. For example, you can exile a card with suspend that has no mana cost or requires a target even if no legal targets are available at that time.
Exiling a card with suspend isn't casting that card. This action doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
If the spell requires any targets, those targets are chosen when the spell is finally cast, not when it's exiled.
If the first triggered ability of suspend (the one that removes time counters) is countered, no time counter is removed. The ability will trigger again during the card's owner's next upkeep.
When the last time counter is removed, the second triggered ability of suspend will trigger. It doesn't matter why the last time counter was removed or what effect removed it.
If the second triggered ability of suspend (the one that lets you cast the card) is countered, the card can't be cast. It remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.
As the second triggered ability resolves, you must cast the card if able. Timing restrictions based on the card's type are ignored.
If you can't cast the card, perhaps because there are no legal targets available, it remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.

If the spell has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those if able. However, if an additional cost includes a mana payment, you are forced to pay that cost only if there's enough mana in your mana pool at the time you cast the spell. You aren't forced to activate any mana abilities, although you may do so if you wish.
A creature cast using suspend will enter the battlefield with haste. It will have haste until another player gains control of it (or, in some rare cases, gains control of the creature spell itself).

78.descricao: When Silverglade Elemental enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

79.descricao:
When Tornado Elemental enters the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.

You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

regras.texto: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

80.descricao: Creatures of the creature type of your choice get +X/+X until end of turn.
80.texto: Kamahl left the violence of his former life behind him, but he still believes in the power of muscle.

81.descricao: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
81.texto: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

regras.texto: Verdant Force's controller gets the tokens. That is the controller at the beginning of upkeep.
Once created, the tokens are independent of Verdant Force. If Verdant Force changes controllers, the new controller will put tokens onto the battlefield, but existing tokens will stay where they are.
In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

82.texto: When the Boros Legion attacks, swiftblades enter the fray first. They pick off the archers and mages, softening the enemy front before the flame-kin and giants go in.

83.descricao: Choose one or both — Branching Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature with flying; and/or Branching Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature without flying.
83.texto:
"Lightning lives in everything, in living flesh and growing things. It must be set free."
—Rakka Mar

regras.texto: You may choose just the first mode (targeting a creature with flying), just the second mode (targeting a creature without flying), or both modes (targeting a creature with flying and a creature without flying). You can't choose a mode unless there's a legal target for it.

84.texto: It holds motionless vigil, watching Naya in silence through the screen of the whitecover. When it senses anything amiss, it launches forward with the uncanny sound of torn fog.

85.descricao: The next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn is dealt to another target creature or player instead.
85.texto: Sisay discovered that the mirrored hull of the Weatherlight could be used as a defensive weapon.

regras.texto: If the second target is no longer on the battlefield, or if the second target is no longer a creature or player when the damage would be redirected, the damage is dealt to the first target as if this spell was not cast.
If the first target is no longer on the battlefield, then the damage will not be dealt at all, so it can't be redirected by this ability.

86.texto: The unit of measurement used to chart a cerodon's growth is "persons consumed."

87.descricao:
Creatures you control have haste.

Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

88.descricao:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.

As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get +0/+2.
88.texto: "Their hopes dashed on our shields! Their victory slashed by our swords!"

regras.texto: There is never a point at which Glory of Warfare will give a creature you control +2/+2 or +0/+0. A creature that's normally 1/1, for example, will change from being 3/1 to being 1/3 when your turn ends and another player's turn begins. At no time will it be 3/3 or 1/1.

89.descricao: Choose one — Destroy target artifact; or destroy target enchantment; or destroy target artifact and target enchantment.
89.texto: "Crovax knows we're coming now," said a grinning Sisay. "I just sent the Predator crashing into his stronghold."

90.descricao: Lightning Helix deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.
90.texto: Though less well-known than its army of soldiers, the Boros Legion's mage-priests are as respected by the innocent as they are hated by the ghosts of the guilty.

regras.texto: If the creature or player is an illegal target as Lightning Helix tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

91.descricao:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, it deals damage equal to its power to defending player.

Equip {3}
91.texto:
"When the wielder is strong enough, any sword will do."
—Kresh the Bloodbraided

regras.texto: This ability triggers and resolves in the declare attackers step. The creature will still deal its combat damage as normal later on during the combat phase.

When the equipped creature attacks, the first ability will trigger. When that ability resolves, that creature will deal damage equal to its power to defending player, even if Mage Slayer has left the battlefield or is equipping a different creature by that time.

92.descricao:
Flying, vigilance, haste

{T}: The next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control this turn is dealt to another target creature instead.
92.texto: Her sword burns with such brightness that foes avert their eyes and arrows divert their paths.

regras.texto: The 3 damage doesn't have to be from the same source, and it doesn't have to be all dealt at once. If only 2 damage is redirected, the next 1 damage will also be redirected.
If either target creature leaves the battlefield before damage is dealt, that damage won't be redirected. It doesn't matter if Razia leaves the battlefield.

93.descricao: At the beginning of your upkeep, Rumbling Slum deals 1 damage to each player.
93.texto: The Orzhov contract the Izzet to animate slum districts and banish them to the wastes. The Gruul adopt them and send them back to the city for vengeance.

94.descricao: Savage Twister deals X damage to each creature.
94.texto:
"Frozen, we watched the funnel pluck up three of the goats—pook! pook! pook!—before we ran for the wadi."
—Travelogue of Najat

95.descricao: Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control or another artifact you control leaves the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
95.texto: Underneath the cities of Esper are cycles of life unseen by those who feed them.

regras.texto: If Sludge Strider and another artifact enter the battlefield under your control at the same time, Sludge Strider's triggered ability will trigger. Similarly, if Sludge Strider and another artifact you control leave the battlefield at the same time, Sludge Strider's triggered ability will trigger.
If an artifact creature with 0 toughness enters the battlefield under your control, Sludge Strider's ability will trigger a total of twice

96.descricao: As Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield, you may reveal any number of other artifact cards from your hand. Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each card revealed this way.

regras.texto: If multiple Arsenal Threshers are entering the battlefield at the same time (for example, if Warp World is resolving), you may reveal the same artifact cards from your hand for each of them.

If Arsenal Thresher and another artifact are entering the battlefield from your hand at the same time, you may reveal that other artifact for Arsenal Thresher. If that artifact is a second Arsenal Thresher, you may reveal each Arsenal Thresher for the other.

97.descricao:
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.

Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.

Whenever you cast a red spell, Balefire Liege deals 3 damage to target player.

Whenever you cast a white spell, you gain 3 life.

regras.texto: The abilities are separate and cumulative. If another creature you control is both of the listed colors, it will get a total of +2/+2.

98.descricao: Whenever you cast a spell that's both red and white, Battlegate Mimic becomes 4/2 and gains first strike until end of turn.
98.texto: Mimics don't need perfect disguises. They need only the perfect victims: the naive, the young, or the poor of sight.

regras.texto: The ability triggers whenever you cast a spell that's both of its listed colors. It doesn't matter whether that spell also happens to be any other colors.

If you cast a spell that's the two appropriate colors for the second time in a turn, the ability triggers again. The Mimic will once again become the power and toughness stated in its ability, which could overwrite power- and toughness-setting effects that have been applied to it in the meantime.
Any other abilities the Mimic may have gained are not affected.

The effect from the ability overwrites other effects that set power and/or toughness if and only if those effects existed before the ability resolved. It will not overwrite effects that modify power or toughness (whether from a static ability, counters, or a resolved spell or ability), nor will it overwrite effects that set power and toughness which come into existence after the ability resolves. Effects that switch the creature's power and toughness are always applied after any other power or toughness changing effects, including this one, regardless of the order in which they are created.

99.descricao:
{1}{R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

{1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

100.descricao: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

101.descricao:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.

When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.

regras.texto: Each of the triggered abilities has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless you control two or more lands of the appropriate land type when the Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you don't control two or more lands of the appropriate land type by the time it resolves.
Both abilities trigger at the same time. You can put them on the stack in any order.
Each of the triggered abilities look at your lands individually. This means that if you only control two dual-lands of the appropriate types, both of the abilities will trigger
Both abilities are optional; you choose whether to use them when they resolve. If an ability has a target, you must choose a target even if you don't plan to use the ability.

102.texto: Hobgoblins are best left alone. They sharpen their farm implements far more than is necessary for their work in the fields.

103a.descricao: Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

103b.descricao: Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

105.descricao:
Trample

Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Arcbound Crusher.

Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

regras.texto: If this creature gets enough -1/-1 counters put on it to cause its toughness to be 0 or less (or the damage marked on it to be lethal), modular will put a number of +1/+1 counters on the target artifact creature equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on this creature before it left the battlefield.

106.descricao:
Whenever Arcbound Slith deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

regras.texto: If this creature gets enough -1/-1 counters put on it to cause its toughness to be 0 or less (or the damage marked on it to be lethal), modular will put a number of +1/+1 counters on the target artifact creature equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on this creature before it left the battlefield.

107.texto:
"Have you ever held a Boros signet? There's a weight to it that belies its size—a weight of strength and of pride."
—Agrus Kos

108.descricao:
Trample

{3}{R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Bosh, Iron Golem deals damage equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost to target creature or player.
108.texto: As Glissa searches for the truth about Memnarch, Bosh searches to unearth the secrets of his past.

109.texto: The elves thought of the myr as minor threats, just as the myr thought of the elves.

110.descricao:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.

{B}{B}: Attach Cranial Plating to target creature you control.

Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

111.descricao: Artifacts you control have indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them. Artifact creatures with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)
111.texto:
"Did it have this shape upon Mirrodin's creation, or did some inconceivable force shape the unshapable?"
—Pontifex, elder researcher

112.descricao:
Door to Nothingness enters the battlefield tapped.

{W}{W}{U}{U}{B}{B}{R}{R}{G}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Door to Nothingness: Target player loses the game.
112.texto:
"All memory of your existence will be wiped from reality. You will die, and no one will mourn."
—Memnarch

113.descricao:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)

{1}, Remove four +1/+1 counters from Etched Oracle: Target player draws three cards.

114.texto: The leonin thought of the myr as omens, never imagining the sinister fate they foretold.

115.texto: The goblins didn't think of the myr at all, which allowed the myr to observe everywhere unhindered.

116.texto: The Moriok saw the myr as fellow scavengers, never knowing just who the myr were scavenging for.

117.descricao:
Trample

Tap an untapped artifact you control: Lodestone Myr gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
117.texto: When necessary, myr can override and control any artificial object, as can their creator.

118.descricao:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink. (If the creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker. Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

119.descricao:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, you may draw two cards. If you do, discard a card.

Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

120.descricao: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
120.texto: Most myr monitor other species. Some myr monitor other myr.

121.descricao: {2}, {T}: Put a 0/1 colorless Pest artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
121.texto: All Auriok children know the tale, "Bolgri and the Long Day of Squashing."

122.descricao:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)

Remove a charge counter from Pentad Prism: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

123.descricao:
Pentavus enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.

{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Pentavus: Put a 1/1 colorless Pentavite artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

{1}, Sacrifice a Pentavite: Put a +1/+1 counter on Pentavus.

regras.texto: You can remove any +1/+1 counter on Pentavus to activate its first activated ability, not just ones created by Pentavus's other abilities.

You can sacrifice any Pentavite creature you control (such as an Adaptive Automaton with Pentavite as its chosen type) to activate Pentavus's second activated ability, not just ones created by Pentavus's other abilities.

124.descricao:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard.

{1}, Exile Relic of Progenitus: Exile all cards from all graveyards. Draw a card.
124.texto: Elves believe the hydra-god Progenitus sleeps beneath Naya, feeding on forgotten magics.

regras.texto: If you activate the first ability, the targeted player chooses which card to exile. The choice is made as the ability resolves.
You can activate the second ability even if no players have any cards in their graveyards. You'll still draw a card.

125.descricao:
Whenever Serum Tank or another artifact enters the battlefield, put a charge counter on Serum Tank.

{3}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Serum Tank: Draw a card.

126.texto: The vedalken saw the myr as toys, unaware of the intelligence lurking behind their empty eyes.

127.descricao: {3}, {T} or {B}, {T}: Return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
127.texto: Metal permeates the marrow of every bone in Mephidross—except one.

regras.texto: You can pay either of the two costs (but not both at the same time) to activate the ability.

128.descricao: Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
128.texto: As the fifth sun joins the other four, new abilities awaken in the creatures of Mirrodin.

129.descricao:
Flying

{U}, Sacrifice Wizard Replica: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.

130.descricao:
(Ancient Den isn't a spell.)

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
130.texto: Taj-Nar, throne of Raksha Golden Cub, destined leader of the leonin prides.

131.descricao:
Boros Garrison enters the battlefield tapped.

When Boros Garrison enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

{T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

regras.texto: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

132.descricao: {2}, {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool for each Swamp you control.
132.texto: Deep within the Cabal's vault, the Mirari pulsed like a dead sun—and its darkness radiated across Otaria.

133.descricao:
(Great Furnace isn't a spell.)

{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
133.texto: Kuldotha, wellspring of molten metal, temple of the goblin horde.

134.descricao:
Gruul Turf enters the battlefield tapped.

When Gruul Turf enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

{T}: Add {R}{G} to your mana pool.

regras.texto: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

135.descricao:
({T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.)

Leechridden Swamp enters the battlefield tapped.

{B}, {T}: Each opponent loses 1 life. Activate this ability only if you control two or more black permanents.

136.descricao:
(Seat of the Synod isn't a spell.)

{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
136.texto: Lumengrid, site of the Knowledge Pool, source of vedalken arcana.

137.descricao:
Shivan Oasis enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
137.texto: Only the hardiest explorers survive to eat the fruit.

138.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{2}{R}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn.
138.texto: Sunhome—the stalwart shield, the towering sentinel, the seat of justice.

regras.texto: If you give double strike to a creature with first strike after first-strike combat damage has been dealt, that creature will also deal damage during the normal combat damage step.
If you give double strike to a creature after either first-strike or normal combat damage has been dealt, it won't help that creature deal any additional combat damage.

139.descricao: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

140.descricao:
(Tree of Tales isn't a spell.)

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
140.texto: Tel-Jilad, sanctum of the ancient trolls, keepers of the secret of Mirrodin's origin.

141.descricao:
(Vault of Whispers isn't a spell.)

{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
141.texto: Ish Sah, den of the warlord Geth, commander of countless nim.
